page.title: 07BICKLEIGH CASTLE
page.content: The recorded history of this property begins in the Domesday Book. 35 acres are now privately owned, the domain and gardens covering 2.25 acres. In 1984 there were 17 000 visitors including many parties of children. The building is of local red sand- stone. The gatehouse is about 500 years old. The farmhouse dates from 1650. The chapel (1090-1110) claims to be the oldest building in the county. 13 rooms are now open to the public, including the first storey hall, 17m long, with a narrow musicians' gallery. There are interesting weapons, pictures, furniture, and items from the Tudor ship "Mary Rose", which has distant connections with earlier residents of the castle. 57 steps and the tower top offer good views. Last year local herons ate all the fish in the remains of the moat.
